alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 4:58PM CDT until April 13 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Lee County in eastern Arkansas... Central Phillips County in eastern Arkansas... South central Crittenden County in eastern Arkansas... Western DeSoto County in northwestern Mississippi... Coahoma County in northwestern Mississippi... Tunica County in northwestern Mississippi... Western Tate County in northwestern Mississippi... Western Quitman County in northwestern Mississippi... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 458 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hughes to near Helena-West Helena to Elaine, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Southaven, Horn Lake, Clarksdale, Hernando, Elaine, St Francis National Park, Helena-West Helena, Jonestown, Friars Point, Walls, Tunica, Crenshaw, Horseshoe Lake, Belen, Lake Cormorant, Strayhorn, Dubbs, Brickeys, North Tunica and Crumrod. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
